comments.body: Is there a non-`dev` release that we can use (i.e. stable release).

The version 1.00 will be released soon on pypt. I tried to link the gitlab directly but I didn't manage to make it lint... If you have time to assist me I can try to make a new pull request for that, but I am afraid it is getting dispersive.
(in the while, I thank you for the help given already!)

after I did the previous suggestions indicated, the tests  
ci/circleci 
continuous-integration/appveyor/pr
continuous-integration/travis-ci/pr

failed

If there is not a non-`dev` release, that's fine. We try to distinguish `dev` releases (by releasing under a different label) if possible to avoid disruption for end users. This only really matters if there are non-`dev` releases that we can package. However it sounds like there are only `dev` releases (this is confirmed by PyPI). So there is nothing more to do here.

TL;DR Don't worry about it. This is fine.

Hi,

So finally we have the 1.0.0 not dev version. How to make an upgrade? I tried to fork and update, it has then been merged, but I think only to my branch?
You should send a pull request against https://github.com/conda-forge/pyretis-feedstock.
